The patient is a 3-1/2-year-old child with history of recurrent otitis media as well as snoring and chronic mouth breathing.

Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, tympanic membrane perforation as well as persistent recurrent otitis media were discussed with the patient and parents and informed consent was signed by the parents.

informed consent was signed by the parents
The patient was brought to the operating room, placed in supine position, given general endotracheal anesthesia. T
The patient was brought to the operating room, placed in supine position, given general endotracheal anesthesia.
The left ear was then draped in a clean fashion.
Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax.
There was no fluid in the middle ear space.
A Micron Bobbin tube was easily placed.

Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax. Myringotomy incision was made in the anterior inferior quadrant. There was no fluid in the middle ear space. A Micron Bobbin tube was easily placed.

Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax. Myringotomy incision was made in the anterior inferior quadrant. There was no fluid in the middle ear space. A Micron Bobbin tube was easily placed. Floxin drops were placed in the ear.

Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax. Myringotomy incision was made in the anterior inferior quadrant. There was no fluid in the middle ear space. A Micron Bobbin tube was easily placed. Floxin drops were placed in the ear. The same was performed on the right side with similar findings.
The patient was then turned to be placed in Rose position.
A small McIvor mouth gag was used to hold open the oral cavity.
There was no submucous cleft felt.
Using a 1:1 mixture of 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine and 0.25% Marcaine
Using a 1:1 mixture of 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine and 0.25% Marcaine,
Using a 1:1 mixture of 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine and 0.25% Marcaine
Using a curved Allis the right tonsil was grasped and pulled medially.
Using a curved Allis the right tonsil was grasped and pulled medially. Tonsil was dissected off the tonsillar fossa using a Coblator. The left tonsil was removed in the similar fashion.
Tonsil was dissected off the tonsillar fossa using a Coblator. The left tonsil was removed in the similar fashion.
Hemostasis then achieved in tonsillar fossa using the Coblator on coagulation setting.
Hemostasis then achieved in tonsillar fossa using the Coblator on coagulation setting.
the patient was found to have enlarged adenoids.
The adenoids were removed using the Coblator.
Stomach contents were then aspirated with saline sump
The patient was woken up from anesthesia, extubated and brought to recovery room in stable condition.
The patient was woken up from anesthesia, extubated and brought to recovery room in stable condition.
There were no intraoperative complications.
Estimated blood loss minimal.
